title: Mysteries: Death, Doubt and Doubling Down
text:
Aaron Gunner, the 60-year-old African-American private investigator in Gar Anthony Haywood’s gritty “Good Man Gone Bad” (Prospect Park, 236 pages, $16), lives and works in a part of Los Angeles “well east of the great class divide that was La Cienega Boulevard.” As such, he’s no stranger to harsh fates and dire deeds. But even he is shaken by the news that his cousin Del Curry has killed his wife, wounded their 22-year-old daughter and committed suicide.

Gunner had thought that he and his cousin were close, but he hadn’t a...
description: “Good Man Gone Bad” is Gar Anthony Haywood’s seventh novel—and best yet—to feature the 60-year-old African-American PI Aaron Gunner.
